column4: Good time Peeps !
How can I re-generate the network-manager config files in ubuntu ?
By restarting network-manager most likely.
I have managed to remove everything in /etc/networking/*  like if-down.d if-post-down.d and everything there !
Do you have still connection?

ironically yes! when but when ever I try /etc/init.d/networking  start/stop I get error, and at startup it takes too long setting the newtorking configuration and then says waiting for 60 more seconds...
Good, 1. sudo apt-get install --reinstall network-manager
reinstall will just use remove, not purge so it wouldn't even touch the config files, I tried it, didn't work. :(
But reinstall will unpack deb once more
So all what you have removed and do belong to network-manager will be replaced
maybe, but even after doing that it's still missing the files.
No worries, first you need to be able to restart network-manager
thanks for the help, but how would I restart the network-manager ?
sudo restart network-manager failed.
sudo service network-maneger restart (or just start)
the restart command, 'restart network-manager' and also start/stop same thing.
sudo service network-maneger status?
network-manager: stop/waiting.
and yet I can user internet !
10 minutes. Need to tidy something.
aight
